content.text:
# Draft:Turbulence Queen

| birth_place        = Guadalupe, Nuevo León
| occupation         = Drag queen, conductora, productora
| nationality        = Mexicana
}}
Turbulence Queen is a mexican drag queen who is popular for her work as a YouTuber, her career as a presenter, and for being one of the pioneers of drag in northern Mexico. His real name is Erick Alejandro Martínez Martínez.
Biography
Early life
He was born and raised in northern Mexico in the city of Guadalupe, in the state of Nuevo León.on october 27,1989.
From the age of 14, he was part of a dance group.
At age 17, he began working as an event entertainer at a party hall.  He then opened his own event agency, Eral, where he offered party planning services, choreography, performances, fireworks rentals, and adult entertainment, including comedians, strippers, and drag queen shows.
He also became a certified Zumba fitness and CrossFit instructor and opened three gyms.
Career
In 2008, at the age of 19, he entered the nightlife scene working as a dancer in drag shows.
In 2010, due to his popularity as a fitness instructor, he was invited to host his own television program on Canal 28 TV Nuevo León called Vida con Energía, which aired for six years. He then worked as a host on Vida y Estilo, a morning magazine program on the same TV channel.
His work as a dancer sparked his interest in cross-dressing, and he experimented in local beauty contests under the name Stephany.
In 2011 the Muxets bar launched its Gala Drag Queen contest (the first drag contest in the state of Nuevo León). Erick entered the second edition of the contest under the name Turbulence (inspired by the song Turbulence by Lil Jon, Steve Aoki & Laidback Luke). She won first place, and a manager from another bar offered to hire her, and that's how she formally began her career as a drag queen. Eventually hosting at almost all the gay bars in the city which made her more popular and allowed her to perform in other cities.
In 2013, he won the Reina de Reinas Muxets contest.
In 2016, he ended his career as a television presenter and closed his fitness academies to devote himself fully to drag.
In 2020, she won third place in the drag contest Toma Mi Dinerita. This made her famous nationwide.
To capitalize on the attention she gained from her participation in Toma Mi Dinerita, she reactivated her YouTube channel Turbulence Drag Queen.
In 2022 with more than 5,000 followers, your friend Iván Guzmán joins the channel with a mascot character of a donkey named Burrita Burrona. Turbulence dressed her in her clothes, modified the shape of the head to fit one of her wigs, and invents the word “mascotidrag”: a combination of the words mascot and drag, which defines the concept of a costume that imitates drag queens.
Turbulence subsequently renamed her channel Turbulence Queen & Burrita Burrona.
In 2023, they both created another channel, El Pódcast del Momento, featuring interviews with celebrities.
In 2024, they appeared on the reality show Divina comida. They were also part of Televisa Deportes' comedy team for the Paris 2024 Summer Olympics special programs. In addition, they were guest judges on Drag Race Mexico 2.
They have also performed in Chile, Colombia, Panama, the Dominican Republic, Costa Rica, and Guatemala, and have done a small tour of 12 cities in the United States.
In 2025, they were special guests on an episode of the comedy series Muero por Marilú on Televisa Univision.
Turbulence is currently the producer and artistic director of her YouTube channels and shows. She has a company that employs members of the drag community. She is Burrita Burrona's stylist and costume designer for both.
In 2025, she had a special theater performance in Mexico's three largest cities to celebrate her 14-year career.
Filmography
Streaming
Host in Reaccionando a K-Dramas. Netflix.
Guest judge in Drag Race México. Temporada 2. Episode 5 Snatch game. WOW Presents.
Music
He has recorded 13 songs for his shows, 10 of them as duets with Burrita Burrona and 3 songs as a solo artist: Check in, Todos quisieron, and Esta noche especial.
Turbulence Queen y Burrita Burrona were invited to sing as part of the opening show of the 90´s Pop Tour Pride CDMX 2024  a music tour produced in Mexico that brings together iconic artists from the 1990s to perform their greatest hits.
Television
* Vida con Energía. Canal 28 Nuevo León. (2010-2016).
* Divina comida México. Season 3. HBO Max. Discovery H&H. (2024).
* La botarguiza en TUDN. Canal 5. Televisa deportes. (2024).
* Muero por Marilú. Season 1. Episode 11: Turbulence y Burrita Burrona llegan a celebrar que Matías salió del clóset. Televisa Univision. (2025).
Theater
* Con tacones a la ver... no (2021-2022).
* Conejo blanco conejo rojo (2023).
Awards
* 1° place 2° Gala drag queen Muxets (2012).
* 1° place Reina de reinas Muxets (2013).
* 3° place Toma mi dinerita. Season 1 (2020).
Con Burrita Burrona:
* Pódcast of the year. Impulse LGBTIQ+ Awards 2023.
* Best stand up. Premios Pepsi Center 2024.
* Contribution to the LGBTQI+ Community and its Positive Impact on Society. Movimiento para la Igualdad en México (MOVii).
